chapterTitle: Return, Risk, and The Security Market Line

columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to compare the beta for Colgate-Palmolive.
A **security's beta** indicates the volatility compared to the overall market. This is the predicted degree of change over securities for a 1% change in market portfolio expected excess.
First, go to finance.yahoo.com and download Colgate-Palmolive's returns for the preceding 60 months. This spreadsheet will provide all of the information needed to complete this activity.

Then, use the market model to estimate the company's beta. The market model is as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
{\text{E(R}_{i}}){\text{ - R}_{f}}&={{\text{a + B[}}{\text{E(R}_{M})}{{-}}{\text{R}_{f}}}{{]}}{\text{+ e}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where:
 
$${\text{E(R}_{i}}) = {\text{Expected return on asset}} \\
{\text{R}_{f}} = {\text{Risk-free}} \\
{\text{[E(R}_{M})}{{-}}{\text{R}_{f}}] = {\text{Marekt risk premium}}\\
{\text{B}} = {\text{Beta}} \\

{\text{a}} = {\text{Alpha}} \\
{\text{e}} = {\text{Error}} \\

After you have calculated the company's beta, compare it to the preceding item's calculation outcome. Examine any changes between using a long time and using a shorter period.

Typically, when the period is different, a company may believe that the discrepancy is insignificant. However, the difference might be significant when it comes to a company with a shorter time frame.

Discuss how the discrepancies in the calculations influenced your monthly returns if they differed from the previous item's outcome. Compile the issues you faced when calculating the beta of the company.
